page.title: 10ECOLOGY
page.content:
Air and Water Pollution
The pollution on Seal Sands can be basically divided up into two sections; firstly Air Pollution and secondly Water Pollution. Of the two, Air Pollution is probably the most common. Air pollution is mostly caused by the heating of furnaces which raises the temperature in the various vessels on all sites sufficiently to allow the chemical processes to take place. As these furnaces are operated at maximum efficiency, combustion is incomplete and so carbon monoxide is produced. In addition to this, fuel oils which are used to heat the furnaces contain organic sulphides and mercaptans which upon combustion release, among others, the gases sulphur dioxide and sulphur
